title: Identity with AptosPassport
description: Explore AptosPassport, a decentralized identity solution built on Aptos that allows users to create, manage, and verify digital identities while maintaining privacy and control over personal data.

tasks.title: Prepare Your Identity Wallet
tasks.description: Add at least 0.05 APT to your wallet to explore AptosPassport features

tasks.title: AptosPassport Basics
tasks.description: Understand what AptosPassport is and its core purpose
tasks.question: What is the primary function of AptosPassport?
options: A physical passport replacement
A travel document verification service
A decentralized identity solution for digital credentials
A KYC service for exchanges
tasks.correctAnswer: A decentralized identity solution for digital credentials

tasks.title: Self-Sovereign Identity
tasks.description: Learning about the concept of self-sovereign identity
tasks.question: What is self-sovereign identity as implemented in AptosPassport?
options: Identity issued by a government
Identity fully controlled by a corporation
User-owned and controlled digital identity
Anonymous identity with no verification

tasks.title: Verifiable Credentials
tasks.question: What are verifiable credentials in AptosPassport?
options: Paper documents that can be scanned
Digital attestations issued by trusted entities that can be cryptographically verified
Password combinations
Randomly generated tokens
tasks.correctAnswer: Digital attestations issued by trusted entities that can be cryptographically verified

tasks.title: Data Privacy
tasks.description: Learn how AptosPassport protects user data
tasks.question: How does AptosPassport handle user data privacy?
options: All data is public on the blockchain
Data is stored in a central database
Selective disclosure allows users to share only necessary information
All data is encrypted but accessible to AptosPassport admins
tasks.correctAnswer: Selective disclosure allows users to share only necessary information

tasks.title: Identity Verification
tasks.question: How are identities typically verified in AptosPassport?
options: Only through government ID submission
Through multiple methods including KYC providers, social verification, and on-chain activity
Only through crypto holdings
Identities are never verified
tasks.correctAnswer: Through multiple methods including KYC providers, social verification, and on-chain activity

tasks.title: Use Cases
tasks.question: Which of these is a use case for AptosPassport?
options: Only for government identification
Only for gaming profiles
KYC for DeFi, reputation systems, access control, and social connections
Only for storing passwords
tasks.correctAnswer: KYC for DeFi, reputation systems, access control, and social connections

tasks.title: Technical Implementation
tasks.question: How is AptosPassport implemented on Aptos?
options: As a centralized web service with API connections to Aptos
Using Move modules for credential issuance and verification
Through a Layer 2 solution
As a purely off-chain system
tasks.correctAnswer: Using Move modules for credential issuance and verification

tasks.title: Credential Revocation
tasks.question: How can credentials be revoked in AptosPassport?
options: Credentials can never be revoked once issued
Only by destroying the entire identity
Issuers can revoke credentials they've issued, and users can revoke credentials they hold
Only through a lengthy court process
tasks.correctAnswer: Issuers can revoke credentials they've issued, and users can revoke credentials they hold

tasks.title: Identity Recovery
tasks.question: What options exist for identity recovery in AptosPassport?
options: No recovery is possible if access is lost
Only through customer support tickets
Social recovery through trusted contacts and multi-signature options
Only through a backup password
tasks.correctAnswer: Social recovery through trusted contacts and multi-signature options
